Formula =IF( PARENT([Calculated % Complete]@row) > 0, PARENT([Calculated % Complete]@row), IF( [EV \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [Budget \[hrs\]]@row, IF( AND([Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> ""), IFERROR( AVG(CHILDREN([Calculated % Complete]@row) ), ""), [Calculated % Complete]@row ) ) ) % Complete Last # System. Used to store % Complete for comparison purposes between days. Activity # The work item or summary header. Activity ID # System autonumber column. Actual [hrs] # Summarizes up through the WBS the Actual Cost which is entered at the Cost Unit level (captured in the Cost System and input to the Project Schedule as actual_hours_recorded . Formula =IF( AND([Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row <> "", [Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row <> 0), [Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row, SUM( CHILDREN([Actual [hrs]]@row) ) ) Actual Finish Date # Represents the date of completion of an activity, where this has occurred, and is equal to the date_finish_planned at that point. Actual Recorded [hrs] # Actual Cost in hours as captured in the Cost System and synced to the Project Schedule. Actual Start Date # Represents the date of commencement of an activity, where this has occurred, and is equal to the date_start_planned at that point. Actual Variance to Baseline Finish Date # Compares the Actual Finish Date ( date_finish_actual ) with the Baseline Finish Date ( date_finish_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Finish Date]@row <> "", [Actual Finish Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Actual Finish Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row) + 1, "" ) Actual Variance to Baseline Start Date # Compares the Actual Start Date ( date_start_actual ) with the Baseline Start Date ( date_start_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Actual Start Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Actual Start Date]@row, [Baseline Start Date]@row) + 1, "" ) AvazaSection # System column for use with the API integration with Avaza. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, INDEX( ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2 ) ) Baseline Finish Date # The finish date for the activity as agreed with the client either explicitly in the Baseline, or implicitly to support explicit commitments in the Baseline. The column is controlled by Smartsheet and will only be updated by a re-baseline in the user interface. Note that the Smartsheet Baseline functionality is not used directly due to various limitations. Baseline Planned % Complete # Determines Schedule % Complete (or "Planned %") at all levels up through the WBS using the Planned Values (calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level as pv_budget_level and summarized upwards as pv_all ) and summarized Budgets ( budget_hours_all ). Note that an activity and summary that does not have a budget ( budget_hours_all ), ie either directly assigned or from it's children, will not have Planned Value. As these may still be considered progressable, the baseline_schedule_%_complete is used as a fallback planned % for those activities or summaries, however the percentage does not impact higher level summaries. Formula =IF( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [PV \[hrs\]]@row / [Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [Baseline Schedule % Complete]@row ) Baseline Schedule % Complete # Determines the Schedule % Complete for an activity (or summary) at the data date (today) as a linearization of progress from the Baseline Start Date to the Baseline Finish Dates, factoring in non-working days in the project calendar. Note that the values yielded for summaries in the WBS are not accurate portrayals of Planned Value as these linearize at those summary levels only. Accurate "Planned %" is given by comp%_baseline_planned_all . Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Baseline Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( TODAY() < [Baseline Start Date]@row, 0, IF( TODAY() >= [Baseline Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS( [Baseline Start Date]@row, TODAY() ) / NETWORKDAYS( [Baseline Start Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row ) ) ), 2), 0 ) Baseline Start Date # The start date for the activity as agreed with the client either explicitly in the Baseline, or implicitly to support explicit commitments in the Baseline. The column is controlled by Smartsheet and will only be updated by a re-baseline in the user interface. Note that the Smartsheet Baseline functionality is not used directly due to various limitations. Budget [hrs] # Summarizes up through the WBS the Budgeted Cost, in hours, which is entered at various budgeted levels (captured in the Baseline and input to the schedule as budget_hours_assigned . Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row <> 0), [Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) ) Budget Assigned [hrs] # Budgeted Cost, in hours, as assigned to relevant individual activities. The sum of the assigned budgets equals the total project Budgeted Cost, and is summarised up through the WBS as budget_hours_all . Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs] # Represents the approved Budgeted Cost, in hours, for the activity budget_hours_assigned plus any additional hours that have been requested formally but not yet been approved budget_hours_requested . Formula =[Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row + [Budget Requested [hrs]]@row Budget Issues # Used to assist in assigning Budget using the budget_hours_assigned column, providing indication where overlapping budgets have been assigned, ie where assignments have been made on ancestors to an activity that has also been directly assigned a budget. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_budget_issues is checked. Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> " ), IF( SUM( CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row) ) > 0, "Budget also assigned on children"", "" ), "" ) Budget Requested [hrs] # Budgeted additional (unapproved and so not included in the Baseline) Cost, in hours, as assigned to relevant individual activities. Represents the sum of all additional hours requested for the activity (through formal change management with the client) that has not yet been approved and added to the (Baseline) Budget ( budget_hours_assigned ) for the activity. Calculated % Complete # Calculates the % Complete to use for the activity based on the comp%_evm_method selected. Formula =IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Manual % Complete", [Manual % Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Planned % Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Gated", INDEX({GatedProgressSummary - % Complete}, MATCH([Gated Progress Reference]@row, {GatedProgressSummary - Reference}, 0)), IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Apportioned Effort", "NOT SUPPORTED", [Manual % Complete]@row ) ) ) ) Check - Finish Date vs %-Complete # Returns 'Error' when the Finish Date disagrees with the % Complete . The value is used to highlight both fields as requiring attention. Formula =IF( OR( AND( [Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row > TODAY(), [% Complete]@row = 1 ), AND( [Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <= TODAY(), [% Complete]@row <> 1 ) ), "Error", "OK" ) Check - Start Date vs %-Complete # Returns 'Error' when the Start Date disagrees with the % Complete . The value is used to highlight both fields as requiring attention. Formula =IF( OR( AND( [Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row < TODAY(), [% Complete]@row = 0 ), AND( [Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row > TODAY(), [% Complete]@row <> 0 ) ), "Error", "OK" ) Client Hidden? # Checking this column will allow the row to be hidden when applying the Filter - Client Hidden filter. Collapsed View Visible? # Checking this column will mean the row and its parents are visible when applying the Filter - Collapsed View filter. This is useful to maintain a certain schedule view that hides unnecessary detail. Control Conditional Formatting # System column. Formula =IF( [SETTING - Obscure System Columns]# = 1, "Obscure System Columns", "" ) Cost Code # Entry column to define a Cost Unit (by assignment of Cost Code) where costs will be captured in the Cost System. Alternatively, the Cost Code can be assigned automatically based on the Cost Unit designations made by checking the cost_unit_designation column. Automatic assignment is the recommended option for a number of reasons and manual Cost Code assignment should not be done without consulting Project Controls. Cost Unit # Optional column to designate a Cost Unit without assigning a Cost Code manually. The GTE Project Portal can then be used to auto-assign the Cost Codes to the designated Cost Units. The assigned Cost Codes will be populated to the cost_code column. Cost Unit Activity # Combines the cost_unit_effective and the activity into a string. Formula =IF( [Cost Code]@row <> "", [Cost Code]@row + " | " + Activity@row, Activity@row ) Cost Unit Issues # Used to assist in designating Cost Units using the cost_unit_designation column, providing details on any designation issues such as overlapping Cost Unit designations or budgeted activities not covered by a Cost Unit designation. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_cost_unit_issues is checked. Formula =IF( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row = 0, "", IF( [Cost Unit]@row = 0, IF( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) > 1, "Multiple ancestor cost unit designations exist", IF( AND( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) = 0, [WBS Level]@row <> 1, OR( COUNT(CHILDREN([Cost Unit Issues]@row)) > 0, COUNT(CHILDREN(Activity@row)) = 0 ) ), "Not cost unit designated, and no applicable ancestor cost units or successor designations to cover all successors", "" ) ), IF( [WBS Level]@row = 1, "Cost unit designation cannot occur at WBS level 1. If a single cost unit is required, assign all budget to a level 2 delivery element and designate this as the cost unit", IF( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) > 0, "Cost unit designated and ancestor cost unit designation(s) also exist", "" ) ) ) ) CPI # Cost Performance Index (based on hours). Formula =IFERROR( [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, "" ) CV # Cost Variance (in hours). Formula =[EV \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row CV % # Cost Variance (in hours), expressed as a percentage of Planned Value (hours). Formula =IFERROR( CV@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, " ) Default FTC [hrs] # Calculates a default value to be used if a Forecast Hours to Finish ( ftc_hours_entry ) is not entered and there is assigned budget for the activity. If there is no assigned budget, the sum of the child activities is used. The value calculated is generally the full assigned budget ( budget_hours_assigned ) as a conservative estimate, however for an EVM Method ( comp%_evm_method ) of "Linearised LoE " the actual hours to date ( actual_hours_recorded ) will be deducted as these activities are expected to meet budget. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row = 1, 0, IF( AND( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( AND( [Assume Linear Performance]# = 1, [% Complete]@row > 0, [Cost Unit]@row = 1 ), [Actual \[hrs\]]@row * (1 - [% Complete]@row) / [% Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Budget \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, [Budget \[hrs\]]@row ) ), SUM(CHILDREN()) ) ) Default FTC Including Change [hrs] # Calculates a default value to be used if a Forecast Hours to Finish ( ftc_hours_entry ) is not entered and there is assigned budget and/or requested hours (through formal change management with the client) for the activity. If there is no assigned or requested hours for the activity, the sum of the child activities is used. The value calculated is generally the full assigned and requested budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ) as a conservative estimate, however for an EVM Method ( comp%_evm_method ) of "Linearised LoE " the actual hours to date ( actual_hours_recorded ) will be deducted. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row = 1, 0, IF( AND( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( AND( [Assume Linear Performance]# = 1, [% Complete]@row > 0, [Cost Unit]@row = 1 ), [Actual \[hrs\]]@row * (1 - [% Complete]@row) / [% Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row ) ), SUM(CHILDREN()) ) ) Descendant Cost Units # System column. Formula =COUNTIF( DESCENDANTS([Cost Unit]@row), 1 ) Discipline(s) # Optional column. Allows the discipline or disciplines involved with the activity row to be defined for possible filtering or reporting uses. Duration # The working days between, and including, the Start ( date_start_planned ) and Finish Dates ( date_finish_planned ) of the activity; where working days are as defined by the project calendar (Smartsheet setting). Effective Cost Unit # Propagates a Cost Code entered at the Cost Unit level down to descendant levels in the WBS for explicitly clarifying where the costs should be captured in the Cost System. Formula =IF( PARENT() <> "", PARENT(), [Cost Code]@row ) Expected Budget [hrs] # Summarizes hours up through the WBS as for budget_hours_all but includes additional hours that may have been requested of the client through formal change management, but not yet approved. The additional hours are input at the budgeted level as budget_hours_requested . Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row <> 0 ), [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) ) EOM+0 Data Date # System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =[EOM+X]# EOM+0 Planned % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [EOM+X PVx \[hrs\]]@row / [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [EOM+X Schedule % Complete]@row ) EOM+0 PVx [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND( [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) ) EOM+0 PVx at Budget Level [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), [EOM+X Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row, 0 ) EOM+0 Schedule % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( [EOM+X]# < [Start Date]@row, 0, IF( [EOM+X]# >= [Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [EOM+X]#) / NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Finish Date]@row) ) ), 2 ), 0 ) EOM+1 Data Date # System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+1 Planned % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+1 PVx [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+1 PVx at Budget Level [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+1 Schedule % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+2 Data Date # System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+2 Planned % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+2 PVx [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+2 PVx at Budget Level [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+2 Schedule % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+3 Data Date # System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+3 Planned % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+3 PVx [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+3 PVx at Budget Level [hrs] # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EOM+3 Schedule % Complete # System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. EV [hrs] # Summarizes up through the WBS the Earned Value calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level (as ev_budget_level ). The lowest possibly determinable level is where both % Complete and Budget Cost, in hours, exist. Formula =IF( AND([EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row = 0, [WBS Descendants]@row > 0), IF( SUM( CHILDREN([EV \[hrs\]]@row) ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN([EV \[hrs\]]@row) ), IFERROR( AVG( CHILDREN([Calculated % Complete]@row)) * IF( SUM( CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row) ) <> 0, SUM(CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row)), [Budget \[hrs\]]@row ), 0 ) ), [EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row ) EV at Budget Level [hrs] # Earned Value (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Earned Value (in hours) for that activity as the budget multiplied by the physical % complete comp% . The duration of the activity is determined from the Baseline Start and Finish dates (as ( baseline_schedule_%_complete ), using date_start_baseline and date_start_baseline , and the budget used only includes the approved (Baseline) budget ( budget_hours_assigned ). Formula =IF( SUM(CHILDREN([EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row)) > 0, 0, [Calculated % Complete]@row * [Budget \[hrs\]]@row ) EVM Method # The default method for determing an activity's % Complete ( comp% ) is using the manual entry column ( comp%_manual ). This column is used to select an alternate method such as "Linearised LoE ", or "Gated". FAC [hrs] # Forecast at Complete (in hours). This is simply the hours incurred to date ( actual_hours_all ) plus the forecast hours to complete ( ftc_hours_all ). Formula =[Actual \[hrs\]]@row + [FTC \[hrs\]]@row FAC Including Change [hrs] # Forecast at Complete (in hours), factoring expected changes to the budget. This is simply the hours incurred to date ( actual_hours_all ) plus the forecast hours to complete, where in this instance this includes change ( ftc_default_with_change ). Formula =[Actual \[hrs\]]@row + [FTC Including Change \[hrs\]]@row Filter - Client View # System column. Formula =IF( OR( [Client Hidden?]@row = 1, PARENT() = "Hidden" ), "Hidden", "Visible" ) Filter - Collapsed View # System column. Formula =IF( OR( [Collapsed View Visible?]@row = 1, COUNTIF(DESCENDANTS(), "Visible" ), "Visible", "Hidden" ) Finish Date # The Finish Date for the activity as most recently planned. This may differ from the Baseline equivalent ( date_finish_baseline ) and may or may not reflect field feedback ( date_finish_fcast ) depending on whether the Project Manager intends to hold or measure the project team to earlier plans. When an activity is complete, the Finish Date should equal the Actual Finish Date ( date_finish_actual ). Flag # A cross (red) indicates an issue on the row. An exclamation (yellow) indicates an issue on a descendant row. The issues can be to do with Budgeting, Cost Coding, or Resourcing and the flags responsiveness to each is dependent on the selected options in the relevant 'Sheet Summary' settings. The specifics of the issues are detailed in the budget_issues , cost_unit_issues and/or resourcing_issues columns as relevant. Formula =IF( COUNT( IF([SETTING - Show Budget Issues]#, [Budget Issues]@row), IF([SETTING - Show Cost Unit Issues]#, [Cost Unit Issues]@row), IF([SETTING - Show Resourcing Issues]#, [Resourcing Issues]@row) ) > 0, "No", IF( COUNT( IF([SETTING - Show Budget Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Budget Issues]@row)), IF([SETTING - Show Cost Unit Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Cost Unit Issues]@row)), IF([SETTING - Show Resourcing Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Resourcing Issues]@row)) ) > 0, "Hold", "" ) ) Forecast Finish Date # The date, forecast by the relevant team member, when it is expected that the activity will be completed. This date informs the Project Manager's update of the (Planned) Start and Finish dates ( date_start_planned and date_finish_planned ), although the Project Manager will not necessarily change these dates based on the feedback. Forecast Hours to Finish # The hours, forecast by the relevant team member, required to finish the activity as considered on the basis of the work completed at the date of entry. The forecast should be reflective of the remaining work, and should not factor budget and/or hours burned to date. FTC [hrs] # Forecast to Complete (in hours). Where a forecast from the frontline is applicable for an activity, generally where that activity is a Cost Unit, this value will be the frontline's forecast (provided as ftc_hours_entry ). Where it has not been entered, and FTCs at the lower level do exist, the sum of these will be used. Failing that, a default value ( ftc_default ) will be used. Formula =IF( [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row <> "", [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row, IF( SUM( CHILDREN() ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN() ), [Default FTC \[hrs\]]@row ) ) FTC Including Change [hrs] # Forecast to Complete (in hours), factoring expected changes to the budget. Where a forecast from the field is applicable for an activity, generally where that activity is a Cost Unit, this value will be the frontline's forecast (provided as ftc_hours_entry ). Where it has not been entered, and FTCs Including Change at the lower level do exist, , the sum of these will be used. Failing that, a default value ( ftc_default_with_change ) will be used. Formula =IF( [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row <> "", [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row, IF( SUM( CHILDREN() ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN() ), [Default FTC Including Change \[hrs\]]@row ) ) FUTURE - Parent for Apportioned Effort # Future - disregard. Gated Progress Reference # Where "Gated" is selected as the earned value measurement method ( comp%_evm_method ), this reference should be set to a Gated Item Reference in the summary register. High Level Schedule(s) # Optional column. Selecting one or more of the existing options, such as 'Comms Site Works', or entering any new custom value allows this column to be used in global report filters to produce high level resourcing views. Information # Free text entry to provide any comments against the activity that should be more visible than row comments. In some instances, this column may be populated from the original estimate and provide detail on the basis of the estimate for example. Manual % Complete # Where "Manual % Complete" is selected as the earned value measurement method ( comp%_evm_method ), or where no selection is made, the physical % Complete of relevant activities should be entered in this column, general by project team members responsible for the work. Modified By # System column. Non-Standard Capacity # Standard resource capacity is 8hrs/day. Set this value where the activity is, for example, performed on site and involves 12hr days not standard 8hr office days. In this example case, type '12'. Planned % Complete # Determines Planned % Complete at all levels up through the WBS using the expected Planned Values, ie budgets including additional requests (calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level as pv_with_change_budget_level and summarized upwards as pv_with_change_all ); and summarized Budgets ( budget_hours_with_change_all ). Note that an activity and summary that does not have a budget ( budget_hours_with_change_all ), ie either directly assigned or from it's children, will not have Planned Value. As these may still be considered progressable, the schedule_%_complete is used as a fallback planned % for those activities or summaries, however the percentage does not impact higher level summaries. Formula =IF( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [PVx \[hrs\]]@row / [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [Schedule % Complete]@row ) Planned Variance to Baseline Finish Date # Compares the (Planned) Finish Date ( date_finish_planned ) with the Baseline Finish Date ( date_finish_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Finish Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row) + 1, "" ) Planned Variance to Baseline Start Date # Compares the (Planned) Start Date ( date_start_planned ) with the Baseline Start Date ( date_start_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Baseline Start Date]@row) + 1, "" ) Predecessors # Used to define relationships between activities as schedule logic. Predecessors (Helper) # Helper column used in evaluating the Successors column Formula ="|" + SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE(Predecessors@row, ",", "|"), "S", "|"), "F", "|"), " ", "") + "|" Project # System mirror of Sheet Summary value. Formula =IFERROR("P" + [Project ID]# + " - " + [Project Name]#, "Enter Project ID in Sheet Summary") PV [hrs] # Summarizes up through the WBS the Planned Value (in hours) calculated at the budgeted (or lowest possibly "determinable") level (as pv_budget_level ). Formula =IF( AND([PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) ) PV at Budget Level [hrs] # Planned Value (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Planned Value (in hours) for that activity as the budget multiplied by the percentage of time through the duration of the activity. The duration of the activity is determined from the Baseline Start and Finish dates ( date_start_baseline and date_finish_baseline ) as comp%_schedule_planned_all , and the budget used only includes the approved (Baseline) budget ( budget_hours_assigned ). Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [Baseline Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row, 0 ) PVx [hrs] # Summarizes up through the WBS the Planned Value (in hours) calculated at the budgeted (or lowest possibly "determinable") level as pv_with_change_budget_level , where this includes additional requested budget as well as approved/assigned budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ). Formula =IF( AND([PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM( CHILDREN() ) ) PVx at Budget Level [hrs] # Planned Value Expected (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Planned Value (in hours) for that activity as that budget multiplied by the percentage of time through the duration of the activity. "Expected" means that in this instance the duration of the activity is determined from the Start and Finish dates from the current plan (as schedule_%_complete ), using date_start_planned and date_finish_planned ), and the budget used is actually the approved/assigned budget plus any additional requested budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ). Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row, 0 ) Reimbursable Activity # Propagates the assignment of reimbursable activities, entered as a higher level designation (using reimb_designation ) down to descendant levels in the WBS . Formula =IF( OR( [Reimbursable?]@row = 1, PARENT() = 1 ), 1, 0 ) Reimbursable? # For projects that include both lump sum and reimbursable (rates based) components, checking this column will designate the reimbursable items in the schedule. The designation will apply to all descendants of any checked item as determined by is_reimb_activity . Resource(s) # Used to assign one or more human resources to budgeted activities. The assigned resource(s) share the budget requirement equally, linearised over the activity duration, for the purpose of assessing resource loading. Resourcing Issues # Used to assist in designating human resource(s) using the resources column, providing details on any missing assignments or overloaded resources, and where an activity duration has not been properly established to allow the resource loading to be determined. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_resourcing_issues is checked. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row <> 1, IF( AND( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) <> 0, [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( Duration@row <> 0, IF( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row / Duration@row /( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8 ) ) > 1, "Assigned resource(s) overloaded: " + (100 * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row / Duration@row /( (COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8 ) ) ) + "%"), "" ), "Duration issue" ), IF( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, "Resource assignment required" ) ) ) Resource Loading # Calculates the % of a single resource's capacity required to complete a budgeted activity, where this is a linear distribution of the remaining work over the remaining duration of the activity, divided by the number of resources and the daily capacity in hours of those resources (assumed to be 8hrs unless otherwise set using non_standard_capacity ) .If the activity is completely planned in the past (i.e. Finish Date < Today) and the FTC is non-zero, warning is. This is achieved by failing the formula (division by 0) and displaying blank content. Since the column is used in Resource Management (as 'Allocation %' column), system automatically sets blank value to 100% and this is by use of conditional formatting rule displayed with the orange font.. Formula =IFERROR( ( [FTC \[hrs\]]@row / IF( [Finish Date]@row > TODAY(), NETWORKDAYS( IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY(), TODAY(), [Start Date]@row ), [Finish Date]@row ), IF([FTC \[hrs\]]@row = 0, 1, 0) ) ) / ( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8) ), "" ) Row ID # Value mirrorring the row sequence number of the row (used in other formulas eg Successor). Formula =COUNTIFS(Activity$1:Activity@row, OR(@cell = "", @cell <> "")) (Note: this is not a column formula !) Schedule % Complete # Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( TODAY() < [Start Date]@row, 0, IF( TODAY() >= [Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, TODAY()) / NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Finish Date]@row) ) ), 2 ), 0 ) Sheet # System mirror of Sheet Summary value. Formula =Sheet# SPI # Schedule Performance Index (based on hours). Formula =IFERROR( [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, "" ) Start Date # The Start Date for the activity as most recently planned. This may differ from the Baseline equivalent ( date_start_baseline ) and may or may not reflect field feedback ( date_start_fcast ) depending on whether the Project Manager intends to hold or measure the project team to earlier plans. When an activity is complete, the Finish Date should equal the Actual Finish Date ( date_start_actual ). Status # System column. Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row <> "", IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row < TODAY() - 7, "Finished", IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row <= TODAY(), "Finished Recently", "ERROR - Actual Finish Date is in the future" ) ), IF( [Finish Date]@row < TODAY() + 7, "Finishing Soon", IF( [Start Date]@row <= TODAY(), IF( [% Complete]@row < 1, "In Progress", "Finished - Record Actual Finish Date" ), IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 7, "Starting <1 Week", IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 28, "Starting Later <1M (and >1W)", IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 84, "Starting Later <3M (and >1M)", "Starting Later >3M" ) ) ) ) ) ), "Not scheduled" ) Successors # Showing task numbers of all those tasks that are linked this task through any type of dependency. The field is not editable and is only used for informative purposes. Formula =JOIN( COLLECT([Row ID]:[Row ID], [Predecessors (Helper)]:[Predecessors (Helper)], FIND("|" + [Row ID]@row + "|", @cell) > 0), "," ) SV # Schedule Variance (in hours). Formula =[EV \[hrs\]]@row - [PV \[hrs\]]@row SV% # Schedule Variance (in hours), expressed as percentage of Planned Value (hours). Formula =IFERROR( SV@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, "" ) Variance # Smartsheet generated column that shows the difference between the Baseline Finish Date and the Finish Date . Should yield the same result as var_date_finish_planned_to_baseline . Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 3, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 3) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 4, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 4) ) ) ) ) WBS # System column. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 3, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 3) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 4, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 4) ) ) ) ) WBS Descendants # System column. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <> 1, COUNT(DESCENDANTS()), SUM(CHILDREN() ) WBS Level # System column. Represents the level in the WBS for the activity. Formula =COUNT(ANCESTORS()) + 1

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the % Complete which is determined at lower activity levels (as comp% ). Formula =IF( PARENT([Calculated % Complete]@row) > 0, PARENT([Calculated % Complete]@row), IF( [EV \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [Budget \[hrs\]]@row, IF( AND([Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> ""), IFERROR( AVG(CHILDREN([Calculated % Complete]@row) ), ""), [Calculated % Complete]@row ) ) )

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the Actual Cost which is entered at the Cost Unit level (captured in the Cost System and input to the Project Schedule as actual_hours_recorded . Formula =IF( AND([Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row <> "", [Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row <> 0), [Actual Recorded [hrs]]@row, SUM( CHILDREN([Actual [hrs]]@row) ) )

docs.text: Represents the date of completion of an activity, where this has occurred, and is equal to the date_finish_planned at that point.
docs.title: Actual Finish Date

docs.text: Actual Cost in hours as captured in the Cost System and synced to the Project Schedule.
docs.title: Actual Recorded [hrs]

docs.text: Represents the date of commencement of an activity, where this has occurred, and is equal to the date_start_planned at that point.
docs.title: Actual Start Date

docs.text: Compares the Actual Finish Date ( date_finish_actual ) with the Baseline Finish Date ( date_finish_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Finish Date]@row <> "", [Actual Finish Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Actual Finish Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row) + 1, "" )
docs.title: Actual Variance to Baseline Finish Date

docs.text: Compares the Actual Start Date ( date_start_actual ) with the Baseline Start Date ( date_start_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Actual Start Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Actual Start Date]@row, [Baseline Start Date]@row) + 1, "" )
docs.title: Actual Variance to Baseline Start Date

docs.text: System column for use with the API integration with Avaza. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, INDEX( ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2 ) )
docs.title: AvazaSection

docs.text: The finish date for the activity as agreed with the client either explicitly in the Baseline, or implicitly to support explicit commitments in the Baseline. The column is controlled by Smartsheet and will only be updated by a re-baseline in the user interface. Note that the Smartsheet Baseline functionality is not used directly due to various limitations.
docs.title: Baseline Finish Date

docs.text: Determines Schedule % Complete (or "Planned %") at all levels up through the WBS using the Planned Values (calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level as pv_budget_level and summarized upwards as pv_all ) and summarized Budgets ( budget_hours_all ). Note that an activity and summary that does not have a budget ( budget_hours_all ), ie either directly assigned or from it's children, will not have Planned Value. As these may still be considered progressable, the baseline_schedule_%_complete is used as a fallback planned % for those activities or summaries, however the percentage does not impact higher level summaries. Formula =IF( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [PV \[hrs\]]@row / [Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [Baseline Schedule % Complete]@row )
docs.title: Baseline Planned % Complete

docs.text: Determines the Schedule % Complete for an activity (or summary) at the data date (today) as a linearization of progress from the Baseline Start Date to the Baseline Finish Dates, factoring in non-working days in the project calendar. Note that the values yielded for summaries in the WBS are not accurate portrayals of Planned Value as these linearize at those summary levels only. Accurate "Planned %" is given by comp%_baseline_planned_all . Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Baseline Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( TODAY() < [Baseline Start Date]@row, 0, IF( TODAY() >= [Baseline Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS( [Baseline Start Date]@row, TODAY() ) / NETWORKDAYS( [Baseline Start Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row ) ) ), 2), 0 )
docs.title: Baseline Schedule % Complete

docs.text: The start date for the activity as agreed with the client either explicitly in the Baseline, or implicitly to support explicit commitments in the Baseline. The column is controlled by Smartsheet and will only be updated by a re-baseline in the user interface. Note that the Smartsheet Baseline functionality is not used directly due to various limitations.
docs.title: Baseline Start Date

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the Budgeted Cost, in hours, which is entered at various budgeted levels (captured in the Baseline and input to the schedule as budget_hours_assigned . Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row <> 0), [Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) )
docs.title: Budget [hrs]

docs.text: Budgeted Cost, in hours, as assigned to relevant individual activities. The sum of the assigned budgets equals the total project Budgeted Cost, and is summarised up through the WBS as budget_hours_all .
docs.title: Budget Assigned [hrs]

docs.text: Represents the approved Budgeted Cost, in hours, for the activity budget_hours_assigned plus any additional hours that have been requested formally but not yet been approved budget_hours_requested . Formula =[Budget Assigned [hrs]]@row + [Budget Requested [hrs]]@row
docs.title: Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]

docs.text: Used to assist in assigning Budget using the budget_hours_assigned column, providing indication where overlapping budgets have been assigned, ie where assignments have been made on ancestors to an activity that has also been directly assigned a budget. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_budget_issues is checked. Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> " ), IF( SUM( CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row) ) > 0, "Budget also assigned on children"", "" ), "" )
docs.title: Budget Issues

docs.text: Budgeted additional (unapproved and so not included in the Baseline) Cost, in hours, as assigned to relevant individual activities. Represents the sum of all additional hours requested for the activity (through formal change management with the client) that has not yet been approved and added to the (Baseline) Budget ( budget_hours_assigned ) for the activity.
docs.title: Budget Requested [hrs]

docs.text: Calculates the % Complete to use for the activity based on the comp%_evm_method selected. Formula =IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Manual % Complete", [Manual % Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Planned % Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Gated", INDEX({GatedProgressSummary - % Complete}, MATCH([Gated Progress Reference]@row, {GatedProgressSummary - Reference}, 0)), IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Apportioned Effort", "NOT SUPPORTED", [Manual % Complete]@row ) ) ) )
docs.title: Calculated % Complete

docs.text: Returns 'Error' when the Finish Date disagrees with the % Complete . The value is used to highlight both fields as requiring attention. Formula =IF( OR( AND( [Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row > TODAY(), [% Complete]@row = 1 ), AND( [Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <= TODAY(), [% Complete]@row <> 1 ) ), "Error", "OK" )
docs.title: Check - Finish Date vs %-Complete

docs.text: Returns 'Error' when the Start Date disagrees with the % Complete . The value is used to highlight both fields as requiring attention. Formula =IF( OR( AND( [Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row < TODAY(), [% Complete]@row = 0 ), AND( [Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row > TODAY(), [% Complete]@row <> 0 ) ), "Error", "OK" )
docs.title: Check - Start Date vs %-Complete

docs.text: Checking this column will allow the row to be hidden when applying the Filter - Client Hidden filter.
docs.title: Client Hidden?

docs.text: Checking this column will mean the row and its parents are visible when applying the Filter - Collapsed View filter. This is useful to maintain a certain schedule view that hides unnecessary detail.
docs.title: Collapsed View Visible?

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( [SETTING - Obscure System Columns]# = 1, "Obscure System Columns", "" )
docs.title: Control Conditional Formatting

docs.text: Entry column to define a Cost Unit (by assignment of Cost Code) where costs will be captured in the Cost System. Alternatively, the Cost Code can be assigned automatically based on the Cost Unit designations made by checking the cost_unit_designation column. Automatic assignment is the recommended option for a number of reasons and manual Cost Code assignment should not be done without consulting Project Controls.
docs.title: Cost Code

docs.text: Optional column to designate a Cost Unit without assigning a Cost Code manually. The GTE Project Portal can then be used to auto-assign the Cost Codes to the designated Cost Units. The assigned Cost Codes will be populated to the cost_code column.
docs.title: Cost Unit

docs.text: Combines the cost_unit_effective and the activity into a string. Formula =IF( [Cost Code]@row <> "", [Cost Code]@row + " | " + Activity@row, Activity@row )
docs.title: Cost Unit Activity

docs.text: Used to assist in designating Cost Units using the cost_unit_designation column, providing details on any designation issues such as overlapping Cost Unit designations or budgeted activities not covered by a Cost Unit designation. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_cost_unit_issues is checked. Formula =IF( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row = 0, "", IF( [Cost Unit]@row = 0, IF( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) > 1, "Multiple ancestor cost unit designations exist", IF( AND( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) = 0, [WBS Level]@row <> 1, OR( COUNT(CHILDREN([Cost Unit Issues]@row)) > 0, COUNT(CHILDREN(Activity@row)) = 0 ) ), "Not cost unit designated, and no applicable ancestor cost units or successor designations to cover all successors", "" ) ), IF( [WBS Level]@row = 1, "Cost unit designation cannot occur at WBS level 1. If a single cost unit is required, assign all budget to a level 2 delivery element and designate this as the cost unit", IF( COUNTIF(ANCESTORS([Cost Unit]@row), 1) > 0, "Cost unit designated and ancestor cost unit designation(s) also exist", "" ) ) ) )
docs.title: Cost Unit Issues

docs.text: Cost Performance Index (based on hours). Formula =IFERROR( [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, "" )
docs.title: CPI

docs.text: Cost Variance (in hours). Formula =[EV \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row
docs.title: CV

docs.text: Cost Variance (in hours), expressed as a percentage of Planned Value (hours). Formula =IFERROR( CV@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, " )
docs.title: CV%

docs.text: Calculates a default value to be used if a Forecast Hours to Finish ( ftc_hours_entry ) is not entered and there is assigned budget for the activity. If there is no assigned budget, the sum of the child activities is used. The value calculated is generally the full assigned budget ( budget_hours_assigned ) as a conservative estimate, however for an EVM Method ( comp%_evm_method ) of "Linearised LoE " the actual hours to date ( actual_hours_recorded ) will be deducted as these activities are expected to meet budget. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row = 1, 0, IF( AND( [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( AND( [Assume Linear Performance]# = 1, [% Complete]@row > 0, [Cost Unit]@row = 1 ), [Actual \[hrs\]]@row * (1 - [% Complete]@row) / [% Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Budget \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, [Budget \[hrs\]]@row ) ), SUM(CHILDREN()) ) )
docs.title: Default FTC [hrs]

docs.text: Calculates a default value to be used if a Forecast Hours to Finish ( ftc_hours_entry ) is not entered and there is assigned budget and/or requested hours (through formal change management with the client) for the activity. If there is no assigned or requested hours for the activity, the sum of the child activities is used. The value calculated is generally the full assigned and requested budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ) as a conservative estimate, however for an EVM Method ( comp%_evm_method ) of "Linearised LoE " the actual hours to date ( actual_hours_recorded ) will be deducted. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row = 1, 0, IF( AND( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( AND( [Assume Linear Performance]# = 1, [% Complete]@row > 0, [Cost Unit]@row = 1 ), [Actual \[hrs\]]@row * (1 - [% Complete]@row) / [% Complete]@row, IF( [EVM Method]@row = "Linearised LoE", [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row - [Actual \[hrs\]]@row, [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row ) ), SUM(CHILDREN()) ) )
docs.title: Default FTC Including Change [hrs]

docs.text: System column. Formula =COUNTIF( DESCENDANTS([Cost Unit]@row), 1 )
docs.title: Descendant Cost Units

docs.text: Optional column. Allows the discipline or disciplines involved with the activity row to be defined for possible filtering or reporting uses.
docs.title: Discipline(s)

docs.text: The working days between, and including, the Start ( date_start_planned ) and Finish Dates ( date_finish_planned ) of the activity; where working days are as defined by the project calendar (Smartsheet setting).
docs.title: Duration

docs.text: Propagates a Cost Code entered at the Cost Unit level down to descendant levels in the WBS for explicitly clarifying where the costs should be captured in the Cost System. Formula =IF( PARENT() <> "", PARENT(), [Cost Code]@row )
docs.title: Effective Cost Unit

docs.text: Summarizes hours up through the WBS as for budget_hours_all but includes additional hours that may have been requested of the client through formal change management, but not yet approved. The additional hours are input at the budgeted level as budget_hours_requested . Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row <> 0 ), [Budget Assigned + Requested [hrs]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) )
docs.title: Expected Budget [hrs]

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =[EOM+X]#
docs.title: EOM+0 Data Date

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [EOM+X PVx \[hrs\]]@row / [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [EOM+X Schedule % Complete]@row )
docs.title: EOM+0 Planned % Complete

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND( [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), [EOM+X PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) )
docs.title: EOM+0 PVx [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND( [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), [EOM+X Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned + Requested \[hrs\]]@row, 0 )
docs.title: EOM+0 PVx at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts. Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( [EOM+X]# < [Start Date]@row, 0, IF( [EOM+X]# >= [Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [EOM+X]#) / NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Finish Date]@row) ) ), 2 ), 0 )
docs.title: EOM+0 Schedule % Complete

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+1 Data Date

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+1 Planned % Complete

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+1 PVx [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+1 PVx at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+1 Schedule % Complete

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+2 Data Date

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+2 Planned % Complete

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+2 PVx [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+2 PVx at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+2 Schedule % Complete

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+3 Data Date

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+3 Planned % Complete

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+3 PVx [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+3 PVx at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: System calculation used for Cash Flow Forecasts.
docs.title: EOM+3 Schedule % Complete

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the Earned Value calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level (as ev_budget_level ). The lowest possibly determinable level is where both % Complete and Budget Cost, in hours, exist. Formula =IF( AND([EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row = 0, [WBS Descendants]@row > 0), IF( SUM( CHILDREN([EV \[hrs\]]@row) ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN([EV \[hrs\]]@row) ), IFERROR( AVG( CHILDREN([Calculated % Complete]@row)) * IF( SUM( CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row) ) <> 0, SUM(CHILDREN([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row)), [Budget \[hrs\]]@row ), 0 ) ), [EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row )
docs.title: EV [hrs]

docs.text: Earned Value (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Earned Value (in hours) for that activity as the budget multiplied by the physical % complete comp% . The duration of the activity is determined from the Baseline Start and Finish dates (as ( baseline_schedule_%_complete ), using date_start_baseline and date_start_baseline , and the budget used only includes the approved (Baseline) budget ( budget_hours_assigned ). Formula =IF( SUM(CHILDREN([EV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row)) > 0, 0, [Calculated % Complete]@row * [Budget \[hrs\]]@row )
docs.title: EV at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: The default method for determing an activity's % Complete ( comp% ) is using the manual entry column ( comp%_manual ). This column is used to select an alternate method such as "Linearised LoE ", or "Gated".
docs.title: EVM Method

docs.text: Forecast at Complete (in hours). This is simply the hours incurred to date ( actual_hours_all ) plus the forecast hours to complete ( ftc_hours_all ). Formula =[Actual \[hrs\]]@row + [FTC \[hrs\]]@row
docs.title: FAC [hrs]

docs.text: Forecast at Complete (in hours), factoring expected changes to the budget. This is simply the hours incurred to date ( actual_hours_all ) plus the forecast hours to complete, where in this instance this includes change ( ftc_default_with_change ). Formula =[Actual \[hrs\]]@row + [FTC Including Change \[hrs\]]@row
docs.title: FAC Including Change [hrs]

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( OR( [Client Hidden?]@row = 1, PARENT() = "Hidden" ), "Hidden", "Visible" )
docs.title: Filter - Client View

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( OR( [Collapsed View Visible?]@row = 1, COUNTIF(DESCENDANTS(), "Visible" ), "Visible", "Hidden" )
docs.title: Filter - Collapsed View

docs.text: The Finish Date for the activity as most recently planned. This may differ from the Baseline equivalent ( date_finish_baseline ) and may or may not reflect field feedback ( date_finish_fcast ) depending on whether the Project Manager intends to hold or measure the project team to earlier plans. When an activity is complete, the Finish Date should equal the Actual Finish Date ( date_finish_actual ).
docs.title: Finish Date

docs.text: A cross (red) indicates an issue on the row. An exclamation (yellow) indicates an issue on a descendant row. The issues can be to do with Budgeting, Cost Coding, or Resourcing and the flags responsiveness to each is dependent on the selected options in the relevant 'Sheet Summary' settings. The specifics of the issues are detailed in the budget_issues , cost_unit_issues and/or resourcing_issues columns as relevant. Formula =IF( COUNT( IF([SETTING - Show Budget Issues]#, [Budget Issues]@row), IF([SETTING - Show Cost Unit Issues]#, [Cost Unit Issues]@row), IF([SETTING - Show Resourcing Issues]#, [Resourcing Issues]@row) ) > 0, "No", IF( COUNT( IF([SETTING - Show Budget Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Budget Issues]@row)), IF([SETTING - Show Cost Unit Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Cost Unit Issues]@row)), IF([SETTING - Show Resourcing Issues]#, DESCENDANTS([Resourcing Issues]@row)) ) > 0, "Hold", "" ) )
docs.title: Flag

docs.text: The date, forecast by the relevant team member, when it is expected that the activity will be completed. This date informs the Project Manager's update of the (Planned) Start and Finish dates ( date_start_planned and date_finish_planned ), although the Project Manager will not necessarily change these dates based on the feedback.
docs.title: Forecast Finish Date

docs.text: The hours, forecast by the relevant team member, required to finish the activity as considered on the basis of the work completed at the date of entry. The forecast should be reflective of the remaining work, and should not factor budget and/or hours burned to date.
docs.title: Forecast Hours to Finish

docs.text: Forecast to Complete (in hours). Where a forecast from the frontline is applicable for an activity, generally where that activity is a Cost Unit, this value will be the frontline's forecast (provided as ftc_hours_entry ). Where it has not been entered, and FTCs at the lower level do exist, the sum of these will be used. Failing that, a default value ( ftc_default ) will be used. Formula =IF( [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row <> "", [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row, IF( SUM( CHILDREN() ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN() ), [Default FTC \[hrs\]]@row ) )
docs.title: FTC [hrs]

docs.text: Forecast to Complete (in hours), factoring expected changes to the budget. Where a forecast from the field is applicable for an activity, generally where that activity is a Cost Unit, this value will be the frontline's forecast (provided as ftc_hours_entry ). Where it has not been entered, and FTCs Including Change at the lower level do exist, , the sum of these will be used. Failing that, a default value ( ftc_default_with_change ) will be used. Formula =IF( [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row <> "", [Forecast Hours to Finish]@row, IF( SUM( CHILDREN() ) > 0, SUM( CHILDREN() ), [Default FTC Including Change \[hrs\]]@row ) )
docs.title: FTC Including Change [hrs]

docs.text: Future - disregard.
docs.title: FUTURE - Parent for Apportioned Effort

docs.text: Where "Gated" is selected as the earned value measurement method ( comp%_evm_method ), this reference should be set to a Gated Item Reference in the summary register.
docs.title: Gated Progress Reference

docs.text: Optional column. Selecting one or more of the existing options, such as 'Comms Site Works', or entering any new custom value allows this column to be used in global report filters to produce high level resourcing views.
docs.title: High Level Schedule(s)

docs.text: Free text entry to provide any comments against the activity that should be more visible than row comments. In some instances, this column may be populated from the original estimate and provide detail on the basis of the estimate for example.
docs.title: Information

docs.text: Where "Manual % Complete" is selected as the earned value measurement method ( comp%_evm_method ), or where no selection is made, the physical % Complete of relevant activities should be entered in this column, general by project team members responsible for the work.
docs.title: Manual % Complete

docs.text: System column.
docs.title: Modified By

docs.text: Standard resource capacity is 8hrs/day. Set this value where the activity is, for example, performed on site and involves 12hr days not standard 8hr office days. In this example case, type '12'.
docs.title: Non-Standard Capacity

docs.text: Determines Planned % Complete at all levels up through the WBS using the expected Planned Values, ie budgets including additional requests (calculated at the lowest possibly determinable level as pv_with_change_budget_level and summarized upwards as pv_with_change_all ); and summarized Budgets ( budget_hours_with_change_all ). Note that an activity and summary that does not have a budget ( budget_hours_with_change_all ), ie either directly assigned or from it's children, will not have Planned Value. As these may still be considered progressable, the schedule_%_complete is used as a fallback planned % for those activities or summaries, however the percentage does not impact higher level summaries. Formula =IF( [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, [PVx \[hrs\]]@row / [Expected Budget \[hrs\]]@row, [Schedule % Complete]@row )
docs.title: Planned % Complete

docs.text: Compares the (Planned) Finish Date ( date_finish_planned ) with the Baseline Finish Date ( date_finish_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Finish Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Finish Date]@row, [Baseline Finish Date]@row) + 1, "" )
docs.title: Planned Variance to Baseline Finish Date

docs.text: Compares the (Planned) Start Date ( date_start_planned ) with the Baseline Start Date ( date_start_baseline ). Negative variance indicates a slip against the baseline. Formula =IF( AND([Baseline Start Date]@row <> "", [Start Date]@row <> ""), NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Baseline Start Date]@row) + 1, "" )
docs.title: Planned Variance to Baseline Start Date

docs.text: Used to define relationships between activities as schedule logic.
docs.title: Predecessors

docs.text: Helper column used in evaluating the Successors column Formula ="|" + SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE( SUBSTITUTE(Predecessors@row, ",", "|"), "S", "|"), "F", "|"), " ", "") + "|"
docs.title: Predecessors (Helper)

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value. Formula =IFERROR("P" + [Project ID]# + " - " + [Project Name]#, "Enter Project ID in Sheet Summary")
docs.title: Project

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the Planned Value (in hours) calculated at the budgeted (or lowest possibly "determinable") level (as pv_budget_level ). Formula =IF( AND([PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [PV at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM(CHILDREN()) )
docs.title: PV [hrs]

docs.text: Planned Value (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Planned Value (in hours) for that activity as the budget multiplied by the percentage of time through the duration of the activity. The duration of the activity is determined from the Baseline Start and Finish dates ( date_start_baseline and date_finish_baseline ) as comp%_schedule_planned_all , and the budget used only includes the approved (Baseline) budget ( budget_hours_assigned ). Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [Baseline Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row, 0 )
docs.title: PV at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: Summarizes up through the WBS the Planned Value (in hours) calculated at the budgeted (or lowest possibly "determinable") level as pv_with_change_budget_level , where this includes additional requested budget as well as approved/assigned budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ). Formula =IF( AND([PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [PVx at Budget Level \[hrs\]]@row, SUM( CHILDREN() ) )
docs.title: PVx [hrs]

docs.text: Planned Value Expected (in hours) at the budgeted activity level. Where an activity is budgeted, this is the Planned Value (in hours) for that activity as that budget multiplied by the percentage of time through the duration of the activity. "Expected" means that in this instance the duration of the activity is determined from the Start and Finish dates from the current plan (as schedule_%_complete ), using date_start_planned and date_finish_planned ), and the budget used is actually the approved/assigned budget plus any additional requested budget ( budget_hours_assigned_and_requested ). Formula =IF( AND([Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> "", [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0), [Schedule % Complete]@row * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row, 0 )
docs.title: PVx at Budget Level [hrs]

docs.text: Propagates the assignment of reimbursable activities, entered as a higher level designation (using reimb_designation ) down to descendant levels in the WBS . Formula =IF( OR( [Reimbursable?]@row = 1, PARENT() = 1 ), 1, 0 )
docs.title: Reimbursable Activity

docs.text: For projects that include both lump sum and reimbursable (rates based) components, checking this column will designate the reimbursable items in the schedule. The designation will apply to all descendants of any checked item as determined by is_reimb_activity .
docs.title: Reimbursable?

docs.text: Used to assign one or more human resources to budgeted activities. The assigned resource(s) share the budget requirement equally, linearised over the activity duration, for the purpose of assessing resource loading.
docs.title: Resource(s)

docs.text: Used to assist in designating human resource(s) using the resources column, providing details on any missing assignments or overloaded resources, and where an activity duration has not been properly established to allow the resource loading to be determined. Issues in this column will be represented by a symbol in the flag column if the Sheet Summary setting setting_show_resourcing_issues is checked. Formula =IF( [% Complete]@row <> 1, IF( AND( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) <> 0, [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0 ), IF( Duration@row <> 0, IF( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row / Duration@row /( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8 ) ) > 1, "Assigned resource(s) overloaded: " + (100 * [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row / Duration@row /( (COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8 ) ) ) + "%"), "" ), "Duration issue" ), IF( [Budget Assigned \[hrs\]]@row <> 0, "Resource assignment required" ) ) )
docs.title: Resourcing Issues

docs.text: Calculates the % of a single resource's capacity required to complete a budgeted activity, where this is a linear distribution of the remaining work over the remaining duration of the activity, divided by the number of resources and the daily capacity in hours of those resources (assumed to be 8hrs unless otherwise set using non_standard_capacity ) .If the activity is completely planned in the past (i.e. Finish Date < Today) and the FTC is non-zero, warning is. This is achieved by failing the formula (division by 0) and displaying blank content. Since the column is used in Resource Management (as 'Allocation %' column), system automatically sets blank value to 100% and this is by use of conditional formatting rule displayed with the orange font.. Formula =IFERROR( ( [FTC \[hrs\]]@row / IF( [Finish Date]@row > TODAY(), NETWORKDAYS( IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY(), TODAY(), [Start Date]@row ), [Finish Date]@row ), IF([FTC \[hrs\]]@row = 0, 1, 0) ) ) / ( COUNTM([Resource(s)]@row) * IF( [Non-Standard Capacity]@row <> "", [Non-Standard Capacity]@row, 8) ), "" )
docs.title: Resource Loading

docs.text: Value mirrorring the row sequence number of the row (used in other formulas eg Successor). Formula =COUNTIFS(Activity$1:Activity@row, OR(@cell = "", @cell <> "")) (Note: this is not a column formula !)
docs.title: Row ID

docs.text: Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), ROUND( IF( TODAY() < [Start Date]@row, 0, IF( TODAY() >= [Finish Date]@row, 1, NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, TODAY()) / NETWORKDAYS([Start Date]@row, [Finish Date]@row) ) ), 2 ), 0 )
docs.title: Schedule % Complete

docs.text: System mirror of Sheet Summary value. Formula =Sheet#
docs.title: Sheet

docs.text: Schedule Performance Index (based on hours). Formula =IFERROR( [EV \[hrs\]]@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, "" )
docs.title: SPI

docs.text: The Start Date for the activity as most recently planned. This may differ from the Baseline equivalent ( date_start_baseline ) and may or may not reflect field feedback ( date_start_fcast ) depending on whether the Project Manager intends to hold or measure the project team to earlier plans. When an activity is complete, the Finish Date should equal the Actual Finish Date ( date_start_actual ).
docs.title: Start Date

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( AND([Start Date]@row <> "", [Finish Date]@row <> ""), IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row <> "", IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row < TODAY() - 7, "Finished", IF( [Actual Finish Date]@row <= TODAY(), "Finished Recently", "ERROR - Actual Finish Date is in the future" ) ), IF( [Finish Date]@row < TODAY() + 7, "Finishing Soon", IF( [Start Date]@row <= TODAY(), IF( [% Complete]@row < 1, "In Progress", "Finished - Record Actual Finish Date" ), IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 7, "Starting <1 Week", IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 28, "Starting Later <1M (and >1W)", IF( [Start Date]@row < TODAY() + 84, "Starting Later <3M (and >1M)", "Starting Later >3M" ) ) ) ) ) ), "Not scheduled" )
docs.title: Status

docs.text: Showing task numbers of all those tasks that are linked this task through any type of dependency. The field is not editable and is only used for informative purposes. Formula =JOIN( COLLECT([Row ID]:[Row ID], [Predecessors (Helper)]:[Predecessors (Helper)], FIND("|" + [Row ID]@row + "|", @cell) > 0), "," )
docs.title: Successors

docs.text: Schedule Variance (in hours). Formula =[EV \[hrs\]]@row - [PV \[hrs\]]@row
docs.title: SV

docs.text: Schedule Variance (in hours), expressed as percentage of Planned Value (hours). Formula =IFERROR( SV@row / [PV \[hrs\]]@row, "" )
docs.title: SV%

docs.text: Smartsheet generated column that shows the difference between the Baseline Finish Date and the Finish Date . Should yield the same result as var_date_finish_planned_to_baseline . Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 3, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 3) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 4, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 4) ) ) ) )
docs.title: Variance

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, Activity@row, IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 2, INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 2) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 3, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 3) + IF( [WBS Level]@row <= 4, "", " | " + INDEX(ANCESTORS(Activity@row), 4) ) ) ) )
docs.title: WBS

docs.text: System column. Formula =IF( [WBS Level]@row <> 1, COUNT(DESCENDANTS()), SUM(CHILDREN() )
docs.title: WBS Descendants

docs.text: System column. Represents the level in the WBS for the activity. Formula =COUNT(ANCESTORS()) + 1
docs.title: WBS Level

docs.text: Smartsheet TQ / RFI Register # Column Summary # Title Brief Description Detailed Status The detailed status of an RTI which shows precisely where it is within the workflow. Detailed Status ( TQ ) Determines the detailed status for technical queries. Detailed Status ( RFI ) Determines the detailed status for requests for information. Exceeds Max Response Days Determines the detailed status for requests for information. Overdue (or Late) Indicates whether a response is overdue, or was provided later than required/requested. Status A high-level status for RTIs for client reporting purposes. Column Details # Detailed Status # Provides the detailed, system level status of the RTI as either: Preparing , Issued , Re-Issued , or Closed . (An indeterminate status of Unknown Detailed Status is also possible if an error occurs.) The detailed status is the non-client-facing status for internal reports and for determining the precise status of RTIs in the workflow. Formula =IF( [Detailed Status (TQ)]@row <> "", [Detailed Status (TQ)]@row, [Detailed Status (RFI)]@row ) Detailed Status ( TQ ) # Provides the detailed, system level status for TQs only, as one of the following: Approver Actioning Approving Assessing Response Authoriser Actioning Authorising Cancelled Client Actioning Client Finalising Response Client Reviewing SME Response Closed Further Requested Issued Revising SME Actioning An indeterminate status of Unknown Detailed Status is also possible if an error occurs. The detailed status for the TQ is used as the Detailed Status where applicable. ( TQ and RFI formulas are only split due to Smartsheet size constraints.) Formula =IF( [Type of Request]@row = "Technical Query (TQ)", IF( [Status: Technical Approval (by GTE Tech Approver)]@row = "Rejected", IF( [Workflow: Approver's Direction]@row = "Cancel Request", "Cancelled", IF( [Workflow: Approver's Direction]@row = "Request Revision (by Raiser)", IF( [Workflow: Raiser's Direction after Revision]@row = "Submit Revision", "Approving", IF( [Workflow: Raiser's Direction after Revision]@row = "Cancel Request", "Cancelled", "Revising" ) ), IF( [Workflow: Approver's Direction]@row = "Approve (and Request Authorisation)", "Authorising", "Approver Actioning" ) ) ), IF( [Status: Technical Approval (by GTE Tech Approver)]@row = "Approved", IF( [Status: Authorisation (by GTE PM)]@row = "Rejected", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for TQ]@row = "Cancel Request", "Cancelled", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for TQ]@row = "Request Revision (by Raiser)", "Revising", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for TQ]@row = "Request Approval for Amendments", "Approving", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for TQ]@row = "Authorise (and Issue)", "Issued", "Authoriser Actioning" ) ) ) ), IF( [Status: Authorisation (by GTE PM)]@row = "Authorised", IF( [Status: Recommendation Approval (by Client)]@row = "Approved as Recommended", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Accepted", "Closed", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Rejected", IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Delegate for Response (to SME Selected)", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Accepted", "Client Finalising Response", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Rejected", "SME Actioning", "Unknown Detailed Status" ) ), "Further Requested" ), IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Submit Response (As Revised)", "Assessing Response", IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Select Action", "Further Requested", "Assessing Response" ) ) ) ), IF( [Status: Recommendation Approval (by Client)]@row = "Not Approved as Recommended", IF( [Response (Complete When Ready to Issue to GTE)]@row <> "", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Accepted", "Closed", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Rejected", IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Delegate for Response (to SME Selected)", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Accepted", "Client Finalising Response", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Rejected", "SME Actioning", "Unknown Detailed Status" ) ), "Further Requested" ), IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Submit Response (As Revised)", "Assessing Response", "Unknown Detailed Status" ) ) ), IF( [Nominated Delegate or SME (if Req.)]@row <> "", IF( [Technical Response]@row <> "", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Accepted", "Client Finalising Response", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Rejected", "SME Actioning", "Client Reviewing SME Response" ) ), "SME Actioning" ), "Client Actioning" ) ), "Issued" ) ), "Authorising" ) ), "Approving" ) ) ) Detailed Status ( RFI ) # Provides the detailed, system level status for RFIs only, as one of the following: Assessing Response Authoriser Actioning Authorising Cancelled Client Actioning Client Finalising Response Client Reviewing SME Response Closed Further Requested Issued Revising SME Actioning The detailed status for the RFI is used as the Detailed Status where applicable. ( TQ and RFI formulas are only split due to Smartsheet size constraints.) Formula =IF( [Type of Request]@row = "Request for Information (RFI)", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row <> "Rejected", IF( [Status: Authorisation (by GTE PM)]@row = "Authorised", IF( [Response (Complete When Ready to Issue to GTE)]@row <> "", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Accepted", "Closed", IF( [Status: Acceptance of Client Response (by GTE PM)]@row = "Rejected", "Further Requested", "Assessing Response" ) ), IF( [Nominated Delegate or SME (if Req.)]@row <> "", IF( [Technical Response]@row <> "", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Accepted", "Client Finalising Response", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Rejected", "SME Actioning", "Client Reviewing SME Response" ) ), "SME Actioning" ), "Client Actioning" ) ), IF( [Status: Authorisation (by GTE PM)]@row = "Rejected", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for RFI]@row = "Cancel Request", "Cancelled", IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for RFI]@row = "Request Revision (by Raiser)", IF( [Workflow: Raiser's Direction after Revision]@row = "Submit Revision", "Authorising", IF( [Workflow: Raiser's Direction after Revision]@row = "Cancel Request", "Cancelled", "Revising" ) ), IF( [Workflow: Authoriser's Direction for RFI]@row = "Authorise (and Issue)", "Issued", "Authoriser Actioning" ) ) ), "Authorising" ) ), IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Delegate for Response (to SME Selected)", IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Accepted", "Client Finalising Response", "SME Actioning" ), IF( [Status: Acceptance of SME Response (by Client)]@row = "Rejected", "SME Actioning", IF( [Workflow: Means to Address]@row = "Submit Response (as Revised)", "Assessing Response", "Further Requested" ) ) ) ) ) Exceeds Max Response Days # Indicates when a response exceeded the maximum response time, as established in GTE's proposal (nominally 10 days). Formula =AND( [Maximum Response Days]# <> "", IF( [Responded Date]@row <> "", [Responded Date]@row - [Issued Date]@row > [Maximum Response Days]#, TODAY() - [Issued Date]@row > [Maximum Response Days]# ) ) Overdue (or Late) # Indicates when a response is overdue, or was provided later than required/requested. Where a response has not been received, this is because the current date exceeds the Response Required by Date . If a response has been received then the Responded Date must be greater than the Response Required by Date . Formula =AND( [Response Required by Date]@row <> "", IF( [Responded Date]@row <> "", [Responded Date]@row > [Response Required by Date]@row, TODAY() > [Response Required by Date]@row ) ) Status # Provides the high level status of the RTI as either: Preparing Issued Re-Issued Responded Closed An indeterminate status of Unknown Status is also possible if an error occurs. The high level status is the client-facing reporting status. Formula =IF( OR( [Detailed Status]@row = "Approving", [Detailed Status]@row = "Authorising", [Detailed Status]@row = "Authoriser Actioning", [Detailed Status]@row = "Approver Actioning", [Detailed Status]@row = "Revising" ), "Preparing", IF( OR( [Detailed Status]@row = "Issued", [Detailed Status]@row = "Client Actioning", [Detailed Status]@row = "SME Actioning", [Detailed Status]@row = "Client Reviewing SME Response", [Detailed Status]@row = "Client Finalising Response" ), IF( [Overdue (or Late)]@row = 0, "Issued", "Overdue" ), IF( [Detailed Status]@row = "Further Requested", IF( [Overdue (or Late)]@row = 0, "Re-Issued", "Overdue" ), IF( OR( [Detailed Status]@row = "Cancelled", [Detailed Status]@row = "Closed" ), "Closed", IF( [Detailed Status]@row = "Assessing Response", "Responded", "Unknown Status" ) ) ) ) )

docs.text: Cost Approval # Labour/Timesheet Approvals # The Timeline for Timesheets # TO DO Submission deadline: Routinely: 7pm on each Sunday, or COB Friday for most personnel For month end: 7pm on the final calendar day of a month Approval deadline: Routinely: 12pm on each Monday For month end: COB on the 3rd calendar day of a month Establishing Timesheet Approvers # TO DO - generally the PM but may be the Discipline Technical Leads on larger projects. Can also be a client representative Client Timesheet Approvers # TO DO - should "only be for embedded personnel such as secondment" Approving Timesheet Rows # For each timesheet row, the approver should check that the timesheet resource has: Selected the correct 'Section' & 'Task' in Avaza, corresponding to the Cost Unit of the work performed. Selected the correct 'Category', corresponding to the resource's role on the project and generally also the location of work (eg Senior Network Engineer L2 - Office ). Caution Site attendance is generally costed at a higher rate than work in the office. Ensure that 'Site' is appended in the Category name for trips to site. Often, there will be specific Categories for the travel time associated with Site work too. Entered a sensical, professional description of the specific work completed in the 'Notes'. If there are issues with any of the above, the approver should reject the timesheet and include appropriate comments for rectification. Finally, the approver should also review the 'Duration' of each booking both in isolation - in terms of the quantity against the task described - and in the context of past bookings and possibly the status of the task budget. An issue with the task duration/amount should not result in an immediate rejection of the timesheet. The approver should first discuss the issue with the resource and/or raise the issue with the resource's lead, then either reject or accept the timesheet entry after a mutually agreeable outcome has been achieved.
